entries.title: Peru Extends Deadline to Set Elections Demanded by Protesters
entries.description: Peru’s congress extended its deadline to set a date for fresh elections that lawmakers hope will end the political crisis that has left more than 50 dead and disrupted mining, tourism and agriculture.

entries.title: Chris Hipkins Sworn in as New Zealand’s 41st Prime Minister
entries.description: Chris Hipkins, New Zealand's incoming prime minister, during a news conference at the executive wing of the Parliamentary complex, commonly referred to as the "Beehive," in Wellington, New Zealand, on Sunday, Jan. 22, 2023. New Zealand’s ruling Labour Party confirmed that Chris Hipkins will replace Jacinda Ardern as its leader and therefore become the nation’s next prime minister.

entries.title: US Secrets Land in All the Wrong Places as Presidents Ignore Honor System
entries.description: A Watergate-era honor system for safeguarding top-secret information in the White House clearly isn’t working.

entries.title: Biden Immigration Plan Targeted in Suit by GOP-Led States
entries.description: US President Joe Biden speaks during a cabinet meeting at the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Thursday, Jan. 5, 2023. Biden today chastised Republicans for what he called their "inflammatory" migration politics as he detailed new policies to stem migrant crossings ahead of a visit to the US-Mexico border.

entries.title: Imran Khan Confident of Pakistan Election Win, Backs IMF Role
entries.description: Pakistan’s ousted Prime Minister Imran Khan said he’s confident of returning to power this year, and would back a continued role for the International Monetary Fund to prop up the economy and stave off a growing risk of a debt default.

entries.title: Trump Comes to Ex-Adviser Navarro’s Aid in Jan. 6 Contempt Case
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump has come to the aid of Peter Navarro as his one-time trade adviser moves closer to facing a jury trial for defying a congressional subpoena.

entries.title: Immigration to Drive All US Population Growth Within Two Decades
entries.description: US population growth will be driven entirely by immigration within two decades, according to the latest forecasts by the Congressional Budget Office.

entries.title: Biden Says Democrats Won’t Let GOP ‘Wreck’ Economy in Debt-Ceiling Fight
entries.description: Congressional Democrats pressed Republicans to offer a concrete proposal for raising the nation’s debt ceiling and avoiding a default after a meeting on Tuesday with President Joe Biden.

entries.title: Senators Show Off Their Swiftie Bona Fides at Antitrust Hearing
entries.description: Officials knew Ticketmaster was trouble when the hearing began.

entries.title: McConnell Says Debt-Ceiling Solution Hinges on McCarthy, Biden
entries.description: Senate Republican Leader Mitch McConnell says it’s up to President Joe Biden and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy to avert a catastrophic debt default later this year.

entries.title: LIV Golf Claims Condoleezza Rice Sought to Block Justice Department Probe of PGA
entries.description: Saudi Arabia-backed LIV Golf said in a court filing that former US Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice tried to influence the Justice Department to not investigate PGA Tour Inc. for possible antitrust violations as a clash between the rivals heated up last year.

entries.title: Switzerland Takes Step to Allow Arms Re-Exports to Ukraine
entries.description: Switzerland took a crucial step toward allowing other countries to re-export Swiss-made armaments to Ukraine.

entries.title: Rwanda Shot at Congo Fighter Jet for Violating Its Airspace
entries.description: Rwanda shot at a Democratic Republic of Congo Sukhoi-25 fighter jet that violated its airspace on Tuesday as tensions escalate between the two countries.

entries.title: Germany to Send Leopard Tanks to Ukraine, Coalition Partner Says
entries.description: Germany will send heavy Leopard 2 tanks to Ukraine, according to a tweet from the FDP, a member of the country’s three-party governing coalition.

entries.title: Georgia Judge to Consider Releasing Trump Grand Jury Report
entries.description: A judge in Fulton County, Georgia, heard arguments from media organizations Tuesday on whether a special grand jury report on Donald Trump’s alleged interference in the 2020 election should be made public.

entries.title: CDC Chief Shakes Up Agency With New Offices, Leadership
entries.description: Walensky to have more direct oversight of agency divisions, heighten focus on health equity, data

entries.title: Sweden Seeks to Calm Turkey Tensions Running High Over NATO Bid
entries.description: Sweden sought to calm tensions in its NATO accession process after Turkey threatened to block its entry to the defense alliance and Finland hinted that a permanent obstacle might cause it to consider joining alone.

entries.title: US Set to Send Ukraine Abrams Battle Tanks in Major Reversal
entries.description: M1 Abrams tanks are unloaded as U.S. military equipment arrives to the Port of Bremerhaven in Germany in 2020. Photographer: Patrik Stollarz/AFP/Getty Images

entries.title: McHenry Warns Fellow GOP Leaders to Be Reasonable in Debt-Ceiling Talks
entries.description: Financial Services Committee Chairman Patrick McHenry on Tuesday privately warned fellow House Republican leaders to be reasonable and realistic as they demand federal spending cuts in exchange for raising the nation’s debt ceiling, a person familiar with the discussion said.

entries.title: Swiss Covid Leaks Probe Deepens Woes for Country’s New President
entries.description: Swiss President Alain Berset’s political woes deepened after parliamentary auditors announced a probe into alleged leaks of pandemic information by his former press chief to the boss of the country’s biggest tabloid newspaper, Blick.

entries.title: Eurogroup President Under Fire in Ireland Amid Expenses Row
entries.description: Eurogroup President Paschal Donohoe remains embroiled in a domestic Irish expenses row, as he issued a second statement to the country’s parliament and answered lawmakers’ questions about his 2016 and 2020 election campaigns.

entries.title: US Sues Google to Break Up Ad Unit in Escalating Antitrust Fight
entries.description: The US Justice Department and eight states sued Alphabet Inc.’s Google, calling for the break up of the search giant’s ad-technology business over alleged illegal monopolization of the digital advertising market.

entries.title: Classified Documents Found at Pence’s Indiana Home
entries.description: Former Vice President Mike Pence had documents marked as classified at his home in Indiana, which were turned over to the FBI following a recent search, according to a letter from Pence’s attorney to the National Archives.

entries.title: US to Develop Nuclear Engine to Power Crewed Missions to Mars
entries.description: NASA and the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency said on Tuesday they will jointly develop a nuclear thermal rocket engine that will help the US stage crewed missions to Mars.

entries.title: Yellen Reports New Debt-Limit Accounting Maneuver to Congress
entries.description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen advised Congress that her department is deploying an additional accounting maneuver to avert breaching the federal debt limit.

entries.title: Netanyahu Meets With Jordan’s King After Tensions Over Holy Site
entries.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu flew to Amman to meet with Jordan’s King Abdullah II today following an escalation in tensions over a holy site in Jerusalem.

entries.title: Senators Fault Ticketmaster ‘Monopoly’ for Taylor Swift Debacle
entries.description: Senators on Tuesday blamed Live Nation Entertainment Inc.’s market dominance for soaring ticket prices and a terrible customer experience — complaints illustrated by the company’s Ticketmaster unit bungling the massive demand for Taylor Swift tickets last year.

entries.title: Independent Sinema Courted by GOP as Democrat Lines Up Challenge
entries.description: Newly independent Senator Kyrsten Sinema of Arizona is being courted by Senate Republicans ahead of what would be a tough reelection campaign if she chooses to run next year.

entries.title: Trump Walks Away From Another Suit Challenging NY Fraud Probe
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump abandoned his effort to revive a federal lawsuit in New York challenging the state’s civil investigation into potentially fraudulent asset valuations at his real estate company, just days after dropping a related complaint in Florida.

entries.title: Long Island Commuters to Arrive at Grand Central for First Time
entries.description: New Yorkers are about to get a critical commuter service they’ve waited years for: the Long Island Rail Road will run to Manhattan’s Grand Central Terminal.

entries.title: Germany to Give Poland Approval This Week to Send Tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is expected to give Poland approval as soon as Wednesday to re-export its German-made Leopard tanks to Ukraine, according to people familiar with the matter.

entries.title: Lula’s Jab at Central Bank Puts Traders on Edge Across Brazil
entries.description: Shielding the central bank from political meddling in Brazil was no small feat. It took decades of cajoling and lobbying by the financial community to make it the law in 2021.

entries.title: Germany Taps BHW Banker as Finance Agency Co-Head
entries.description: Federal Republic of Germany – Finance Agency (German: Bundesrepublik Deutschland – Finanzagentur GmbH)

entries.title: Zelenskiy’s Call for Justice Triggers Shakeup in His Government
entries.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy dismissed at least 10 officials in a government shakeup following an outcry over perceived excesses by civil servants amid the country’s efforts to fight off Russia’s invasion.

entries.title: South Africans Favor US, Shun Russia in Clash With Policy Bias
entries.description: More than a third of South Africans would choose to work and raise their families in the US while a tiny fraction chose Russia and China out of a choice of six nations, a stark contrast with the government’s foreign policy, a survey showed.

entries.title: Sunak Faces New Rebellion Over Online Porn Age Verification
entries.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is facing another rebellion from members of his Conservative Party who want to toughen legislation so websites are forced to introduce more robust age checks to stop children accessing pornography.

entries.title: Debt-Limit Fight Risks Early End to Fed Quantitative Tightening
entries.description: The Federal Reserve’s quantitative-tightening program risks being propelled toward an early end as US politicians bicker in Washington over raising the national debt limit, according to some economists and bond-market participants.

entries.title: German Government Expects Economy to Grow by 0.2% This Year
entries.description: The German government expects Europe’s biggest economy to grow by 0.2% this year instead of the 0.4% contraction it predicted in October, according to people familiar with new forecasts to be published Wednesday.

entries.title: Battlefield Politics Entangle Ukraine’s Allies
entries.description: As Russia’s war in Ukraine grinds on toward the one-year mark, the broader politics of the response by Kyiv’s allies are getting trickier and more complex.

entries.title: Eskom Has Paid $561 Million in Penalties on Medupi Coal Contract
entries.description: South African power utility Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd., which is struggling to find cash to keep its generators running, paid billions of rand in penalties on a coal contract at one of its newest plants.

entries.title: Jacinda Ardern Leaves a Mixed Record on Tackling Climate Change
entries.description: The outgoing prime minister set up a long-term framework for New Zealand to address global warming, but emissions haven’t been trending downward.

entries.title: South Africa Ombudsman Completes Ramaphosa Farm-Burglary Probe
entries.description: South Africa’s graft ombudsman completed an interim report into a burglary at a game farm owned by President Cyril Ramaphosa.

entries.title: Poland Requests German Permission to Send Tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: Poland formally asked for Germany’s permission to send Leopard 2 battle tanks to Ukraine, adding pressure on Chancellor Olaf Scholz to grant allies approval to re-export the German-made military vehicle.

entries.title: Spyware Finally Got Scary Enough to Freak Lawmakers Out—After It Spied on Them
entries.description: NSO Group’s Pegasus software was used routinely to listen in on conversations with US, UK and EU officials, prompting investigations into abuses of its shockingly affordable military-grade surveillance.

entries.title: South African Government Sued by Opposition Over Power Strategy
entries.description: South Africa’s biggest labor union and three opposition parties sued the nation’s president, the energy and public enterprises ministries and power utility Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd. over their approach to ending a 15-year energy crisis.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Germany Says Decision on Tanks Could Come Soon
entries.description: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius said Chancellor Olaf Scholz is talking to allies about sending Leopard 2 battle tanks to Ukraine and a decision to ship them could come in the next few days.

entries.title: Finland Signals It May Consider NATO Entry Without Sweden
entries.description: Finland may need to reconsider whether to move jointly with Sweden toward membership in NATO after fresh objections to Sweden from Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, according to Finland’s Foreign Minister Pekka Haavisto.

entries.title: Gunman Kills Seven, Wounds One in Two California Shootings
entries.description: Seven people were killed and another severely injured in shootings that took place at two separate locations in Northern California, the local sheriff’s office said, adding that a suspect had been taken into custody.

entries.title: Britain’s NHS Black Hole Is Devouring the Whole Country
entries.description: The UK is facing a stark choice between funding public services or saving its health system.

entries.title: German Indecision on Supplying Tanks to Ukraine Sows Discontent
entries.description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s cautious approach to sending Leopard battle tanks – or allowing other countries to export their own stocks of the German-made military vehicles – to Ukraine is confusing allies and creating splits within his own government.

entries.title: Yellen Faces Tough Act to Follow as Russia, China Embrace Africa
entries.description: Just before US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen will visit South Africa as part of a renewed focus on the continent, she got a stark example of the challenges Washington faces in countering influence by its main global rivals Russia and China.

entries.title: Biden May Have to Act Unilaterally to Avoid Default, Khanna Says
entries.description: The US will not default on its debt but the Biden administration might be forced to take unilateral action to head off a crisis, Representative Ro Khanna, a California Democrat, offering several possible executive maneuvers.

entries.title: US Confronts China Over Companies’ Ties to Russian War Effort
entries.description: The Biden administration has confronted China’s government with evidence that suggests some Chinese state-owned companies may be providing assistance for Russia’s war effort in Ukraine, as it tries to ascertain if Beijing is aware of those activities, according to people familiar with the matter.

entries.title: DOJ Poised to Sue Google Over Digital Ad Market Dominance
entries.description: The US Justice Department is poised to sue Alphabet Inc.’s Google as soon as Tuesday regarding the search giant’s dominance over the digital advertising market, according to people familiar with the matter.

entries.title: UK Failing to Protect Menopausal Women at Work, Committee Says
entries.description: The UK is failing to address menopausal discrimination in the workforce, an issue that led to women quitting their jobs due to a lack of employer support, a committee of lawmakers said.

entries.title: UK Needs Robust Ethical Culture, Says Sunak’s Standards Watchdog
entries.description: The UK’s public sector needs a “robust ethical culture” to ensure people feel safe speaking up about poor behavior, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s standards watchdog warned following a string of allegations of impropriety across government.
